metadata.titleCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验：黑河流域土地利用覆被数据集
metadata.description: The datasets of “Land Cover Map of Heihe River Basin” provide monthly land cover classification data in 2012-2013. The HJ-1/CCD data with both high spatial resolution (30 m) and high temporal (2 days) frequency was used to construct the time series data. The NDVI curves from the time series HJ-1/CCD data can depict the variation of typical land surface. Different land use type has different NDVI curve. Rules were set to extract every land use type information. The datasets of “Land Cover Map of Heihe River Basin” hold the traditional land use types including water bodies, urban and built-up, croplands, evergreen coniferous forests, deciduous broadleaf forests and so on. Crop type classification (including maize, spring wheat, highland barely, rape and so on), snow and ice and glaciers information updates, make the datasets more detailed. Compared with previous land cover map and other products, the classification result of the datasets is visually bette. Especially in middle stream, the accuracy of crop classification is quite high compared with the data from the ground campaign. The accuracy of land cover map of the datasets in 2012 was evaluated using very high spatial resolution remote sensing data within Google Earth and data from campaign, and the overall accuracy can be as high as 92.19%. In a word, the datasets of “Land Cover Map of Heihe River Basin” is not only high in overall accuracy, but also more detailed in crop fine classification. Furthermore, it updated some new classes like glaciers and snow. The datasets of “Land Cover Map of Heihe River Basin” are consequently the classification datasets with the highest accuracy and most detailed information up to now.
metadata.descriptionCn: 黑河流域土地利用覆盖数据集提供了2011-2015年的月度地表类型覆盖数据，该数据利用我国国产卫星HJ/CCD数据兼具较高时间分辨率（组网后2天）和空间分辨率（30m）的特点构造时间序列数据，针对各类地物随时间变化呈现的NDVI时间序列曲线不同，对不同地物特征进行知识归纳，设定提取规则不同地物信息。黑河流域土地利用覆盖数据集保留了传统的土地利用图的基本类别信息，包括水体，城镇，耕地，常绿针叶林，落叶阔叶林等，同时增加了对耕地范围的作物精细分类（包括玉米、大麦、油菜、春小麦等主要作物信息）、更新了上游冰川、积雪等信息，使黑河流域的土地覆盖信息更为详细。 通过和黑河流域历史土地利用图以及其他植被覆盖产品相比，黑河流域土地利用覆盖数据集的分类效果在视觉上都要优于其他数据，利用黑河中游实地调研数据，中游的作物精细分类信息精度也较高。由Google Earth高清影像和实地调研数据对2012年的分类结果进行精度评价，总体精度达到92.19%。总之，黑河流域土地利用覆盖数据集不仅具有较高总体精度而且细化了耕地范围的作物信息，更新了冰川、积雪等地类信息，是精度更高、分类更细的黑河流域地表分类数据。

background: 土地利用是对与土地直接有关的人类活动用地的描述, 它是理解人类活动对区域乃至全球变化影响的关键因素(Running, 2008); 它的分布与变化直接反映人类的经济、社会和文化活动. 土地利用数据是全球变化研究中的关键影响因素, 是陆面过程模型的关键参数, 对于生态、水文和大气模型的提高和发展也起着至关重要的作用(Foley 等, 2005; Jung 等, 2006); 现阶段, 土地利用数据已经被广泛的应用于生物多样性、碳循环、公共卫生、农作物估产、城市化进程以及森林资源监测等方面的研究( 申双和等, 2009; 郑盛等, 2011; Gong 等, 2013; Hall 等, 2011; Liang 等, 2010; Poulter 等, 2011). 长期以来, 随着遥感监测技术的应用发展, 针对区域性乃至全球性土地利用与覆盖及其变化方面开展了深入的研究, 形成了众多的土地利用与覆盖遥感分类和制图方法(阎建忠等, 2005; 张增祥等, 2009); 近年, 国内学者利用神经网络、容差粗糙集以及基于生物群集智能优化等方法在分类方法上进行了尝试(哈斯巴干等, 2003, 2004; 刘小平等, 2007). 目前, 利用可见光近红外遥感图像的土地覆盖分类方法按使用的数据不同大致可分为以下三类: 基于单时相高空间分辨率遥感数据的方法、 基于时间序列中低空间分辨率遥感数据的方法和基于中高空间分辨率与中低分辨率遥感数据结合的方法.
research objective: 本文针对现有土地利用与覆盖制图产品的局限, 利用中国环境与灾害监测预报小卫星星座(HJ 星座)CCD 数据同时具有较高空间与较高时间分辨率的特点, 发展了一种基于时间序列较高空间分辨率数据的土地覆盖分类方法; 该方法既利用了较高空间分辨数据的纹理与光谱信息, 也利用了高时间分辨率数据捕捉到了地表动态变化信息, 从而利用地物在时间维上的差异提高了土地利用制图的精度.
challenges: 本研究从数据选择 (时间序列的 HJ-1/CCD 数据)、分类方法(时间序列的方法) 以及分类结果检验(Google Earth 高分辨率数据、 时间序列数据及历史土地利用图结合的方式)等方面提出了一种基于时间序列 HJ-1/CCD 数据的土地覆盖分类方法, 与传统的分类方法相比能够有效的提高分类的精度与分类结果检验的准确性, 同时降低数据购买、野外调查等各种成本. 但该方法也存在以下问题: 需要用到比传统方法更多的数据( 本研究中使用一年 12 幅图像, 根据目标的不同数据量还可以增加); HJ-1/CCD 数据几何定位和辐射性能都不是现阶段最好的, 需要大量的数据预处理工作来保证图像的质量; 而且很难自动实现, 需要大量人工辅助.
methods: 从研究区域整年的数据中, 选出每个月最好的一景 HJ-1/CCD 图像; 因此, 针对研究区域可以获取一年 12 景的 HJ-1/CCD 图像, 形成研究区域的时间序列图像. 数据预处理主要包括几何精校正、辐射定标与大气校正工作. 本方法将时间序列的 NDVI 作为 SVM 分类器的输入. 本研究利用 SVM 分类器进行分类, 该分类方法需要提供足够的训练样本. 利用 NDVI 完成 SVM 分类后, 还引入了 NDBI 和NDWI 等指数对水和建筑与植被等进行了区分. 在 SVM 分类中, 由于建筑用地与滩涂 NDVI 时间序列变化的差异较小, 大部分的滩涂被划分为了建筑用地; 在分类后处理中, 将建筑用地图层单独提取出来, 再利用 HJ-1/CCD 数据较高空间分辨率(30 m) 的特点, 通过纹理信息对这二者进行二分, 提高了建筑用地和滩涂的区分率, 得到最后的结果.
dataset: 因此, 本研究将选取 HJ-1/CCD 数据作为分类的输入数据. 中国环境与灾害监测预报小卫星星座包括 HJ-1A, HJ-1B 和HJ-1C 三颗卫星, 期中 1A 和1B 发射于 2008 年 9 月 6 日. HJ-1A 搭载了 2 个 CCD 相机(称为 HJ-1A/CCD1 和 HJ-1A/CCD2)和 1 个高光谱成像仪; HJ-1B 搭载了 2 个 CCD 相机(称为 HJ-1B/CCD1 和 HJ-1B/CCD2)和 1 个红外相机. 1A 和 1B 颗卫星总共搭载了 4 个特性基本一致的 CCD 相机( 统称为 HJ-1/CCD), 每个 CCD 相机有红绿蓝和近红外四个波段、幅宽为 360 km 、像素空间分辨率为 30 m. 每颗卫星上的 2 个CCD 相机一起组成了幅宽为 700 km 的推扫成像能力; 因此, 两颗卫星共同形成了 HJ-1/CCD 数据 2 天的重访周期, 使其成为了较高分辨率遥感数据中重访周期最短的数据, 重访周期接近 MODIS 等中低分辨率数据. 将经过大气校正的 HJ-1/CCD 数据按照 NDVI 的计算公式进行计算, 得到一年 12 个月的 NDVI 图像.
findings: 经过比较, 可以发现基于时间序列 HJ-1/CCD 数据的方法具有以下优势: 与传统方法相比, 基于时间序列HJ-1/CCD 数据的方法所分结果与实际情况更加符合. 从辽宁大伙房水库与青海黑泉水库两个差异较大的分类实例可以看出, 利用时间序列 HJ-1/CCD 数据的分类方法具有三个优势: 水体、建筑用地、林地和耕地的分类精度都得到了提高, 小型水体和建筑用地在基于时间序列 HJ-1/CCD 数据的方法中可以较好识别, 线状物体的识别精度也得到有效提高; 与传统方法相比, 基于时间序列 HJ-1/CCD 数据的方法在分类精度上有 10%左右的提高, kappa 系数有 0.1 左右的提高.

datasetCn: 因此，本研究将选取 HJ-1/CCD 数据作为分类的输入数据。中国环境与灾害监测预报小卫星星座包括 HJ-1A、HJ-1B 和 HJ-1C 三颗卫星，其中 1A 和 1B 发射于 2008 年 9 月 6 日。HJ-1A 搭载了 2 个 CCD 相机（称为 HJ-1A/CCD1 和 HJ-1A/CCD2）和 1 个高光谱成像仪；HJ-1B 搭载了 2 个 CCD 相机（称为 HJ-1B/CCD1 和 HJ-1B/CCD2）和 1 个红外相机。1A 和 1B 颗卫星总共搭载了 4 个特性基本一致的 CCD 相机（统称为 HJ-1/CCD），每个 CCD 相机有红、绿、蓝和近红外四个波段，幅宽为 360 km，像素空间分辨率为 30 m。每颗卫星上的 2 个 CCD 相机一起组成了幅宽为 700 km 的推扫成像能力；因此，两颗卫星共同形成了 HJ-1/CCD 数据 2 天的重访周期，使其成为了较高分辨率遥感数据中重访周期最短的数据，重访周期接近 MODIS 等中低分辨率数据。将经过大气校正的 HJ-1/CCD 数据按照 NDVI 的计算公式进行计算，得到一年 12 个月的 NDVI 图像。
findingsCn: 经过比较，可以发现基于时间序列HJ-1/CCD数据的方法具有以下优势：与传统方法相比，基于时间序列HJ-1/CCD数据的方法所分结果与实际情况更加符合。从辽宁大伙房水库与青海黑泉水库两个差异较大的分类实例可以看出，利用时间序列HJ-1/CCD数据的分类方法具有三个优势：水体、建筑用地、林地和耕地的分类精度都得到了提高，小型水体和建筑用地在基于时间序列HJ-1/CCD数据的方法中可以较好识别，线状物体的识别精度也得到有效提高；与传统方法相比，基于时间序列HJ-1/CCD数据的方法在分类精度上有10%左右的提高，kappa系数有0.1左右的提高。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的放大是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套的尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次强烈观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅展示了2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙质沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了强烈观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

background: Land-cover datasets are crucial for research on eco-hydrological processes and earth system modeling. Remote sensing has become widely used as a macro-observing system for land-cover mapping, which can substitute for plant functional type (PFT) as the baseline. Several moderate to fine resolution global land-cover datasets, which are presented in detail in Table I, based on different satellite sensors are available from different research groups. These land-cover datasets listed in Table I have large variability for three reasons: 1) the data quality and properties are different; 2) there is no standard approach for classifying continuous vegetation cover into discrete categories; and 3) they are not consistent with the Earth System Model’s (ESM) requirements, because the concept of PFT, whose traits represent a combination of spectral relationships, and climatic, ecological, and theoretical assumptions, used in ESMs cannot be mapped directly using remote-sensing land-cover datasets. In addition, the classification accuracies of land-cover datasets vary and are hardly suited for land-process modeling and applications at a river basin scale. The highest uncertainty in land-cover classification from optical remotely sensed imagery occurs most frequently between the cropland and grassland categories and in dryland systems among the shrub, grassland, and forest categories because of differences in the minimum threshold required for forest cover. For the HRB, most are distributed over an arid region, so the vegetation classification in the HRB based on current land-cover datasets would cause very large uncertainty and may cause great error or even the failure of eco-hydrological and land-process modeling.
research objective: In order to improve the accuracy of eco-hydrological and land-process modeling in the HRB, a comprehensive method for mapping monthly land cover with fine spatial resolution and more categories of crop/vegetation is developed by using multiple classifiers and multisource remotely sensed data with different spatio-temporal resolutions and spectral bands.
challenges: The highest uncertainty in land-cover classification from optical remotely sensed imagery occurs most frequently between the cropland and grassland categories and in dryland systems among the shrub, grassland, and forest categories because of differences in the minimum threshold required for forest cover. For the HRB, most are distributed over an arid region, so the vegetation classification in the HRB based on current land-cover datasets would cause very large uncertainty and may cause great error or even the failure of eco-hydrological and land-process modeling.
methods: A mosaic of the HRB is made using Landsat/TM imagery. The mosaic of Landsat/TM is used as the base image and all HJ-1/CCD images are automatically corrected through the image-to-image registration method. Converting the DN values of the HJ-1/CCD images to top of atmosphere (TOA) radiance with given calibration coefficients. Removing the atmospheric effects of remote-sensing images to obtain the surface reflectance. After the preprocessing has been done, all the HJ-1/CCD images within 1 month are subset and mosaicked; consequently, 10 mosaics for 10 months in the HRB are made and time series of the HRB mosaics from HJ-1/CCD are constructed.
dataset: The HJ-1/CCD remote-sensing data used in this research were provided by the China Centre for Resources Satellite Data and Application (CRESDA, http://www.cresda.com). The Landsat TM/ETM+ data were downloaded from the USGS website (http://landsat.usgs.gov/). The MODIS data were downloaded from the NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (http://ladsweb.nascom.nasa.gov/). The VHSR data were from Google Earth by Google Inc.
findings: The confusion matrix is used to evaluate the classification accuracy, showing an overall classification accuracy of over 90% in the HRB, which is quite higher than previous approaches. Furthermore, a ground campaign was performed to evaluate the accuracy of crop classification and an overall accuracy of 84.09% for the crop classification was achieved.
backgroundCn: 土地覆盖数据集对于生态水文过程和地球系统建模的研究至关重要。遥感已成为广泛使用的宏观观测系统，用于土地覆盖制图，可以替代植物功能类型（PFT）作为基线。根据不同的卫星传感器，多个中等到精细分辨率的全球土地覆盖数据集可供不同研究小组使用，这些数据集在表I中详细列出。这些土地覆盖数据集存在较大的变异性，原因有三：1）数据质量和属性不同；2）将连续的植被覆盖分类为离散类别没有标准方法；3）它们与地球系统模型（ESM）的要求不一致，因为在ESM中使用的PFT概念，其特征代表了一组光谱关系、气候、生态和理论假设的组合，无法直接通过遥感土地覆盖数据集进行映射。此外，土地覆盖数据集的分类准确性差异很大，难以适用于流域尺度的土地过程建模和应用。光学遥感影像中土地覆盖分类的不确定性最高，通常发生在农田和草地类别之间，以及在干旱地区的灌木、草地和森林类别之间，因为森林覆盖所需的最小阈值存在差异。对于HRB，大部分分布在干旱地区，因此基于当前土地覆盖数据集的HRB植被分类将导致非常大的不确定性，并可能导致生态水文和土地过程建模的重大错误甚至失败。
research objectiveCn: 为了提高HRB地区生态水文和土地过程建模的准确性，开发了一种综合方法，通过使用多种分类器和具有不同时空分辨率和光谱波段的多源遥感数据，进行每月土地覆盖的细致空间分辨率和更多作物/植被类别的制图。
challengesCn: 光学遥感影像的土地覆盖分类中，最高的不确定性最常发生在农田和草地类别之间，以及在干旱地区的灌木、草地和森林类别之间，这主要是由于森林覆盖所需的最低阈值差异。在HRB地区，大部分分布在干旱区域，因此基于当前土地覆盖数据集的HRB植被分类将导致非常大的不确定性，并可能造成严重错误，甚至导致生态水文和土地过程建模的失败。
methodsCn: HRB的马赛克图是使用Landsat/TM影像制作的。Landsat/TM的马赛克图作为基础影像，所有HJ-1/CCD影像通过影像间配准方法自动校正。使用给定的校准系数将HJ-1/CCD影像的DN值转换为大气顶辐射率（TOA）进行处理。去除遥感影像的气象效应以获得表面反射率。在完成预处理后，所有在1个月内的HJ-1/CCD影像被子集并拼接；因此，HRB在10个月内制作了10个马赛克图，并构建了HJ-1/CCD的时间序列马赛克图。
datasetCn: 本研究中使用的HJ-1/CCD遥感数据由中国资源卫星数据与应用中心（CRESDA，http://www.cresda.com）提供。Landsat TM/ETM+数据从USGS网站（http://landsat.usgs.gov/）下载。MODIS数据从NASA戈达德太空飞行中心（http://ladsweb.nascom.nasa.gov/）下载。VHSR数据来自谷歌公司（Google Inc.）的谷歌地球（Google Earth）。
findingsCn: 混淆矩阵用于评估分类准确性，HRB的整体分类准确率超过90%，这比之前的方法高得多。此外，进行了地面调查以评估作物分类的准确性，最终实现了84.09%的整体作物分类准确率。

background: Accurate and up-to-date global land cover data sets are necessary for various global change research studies including climate change, biodiversity conservation, ecosystem assessment, and environmental modeling. In recent years, substantial advancement has been achieved in generating such data products. Two new global land cover data sets, Global Land Cover 2000 (GLC-2000) and MODerate resolution Imaging Spectrometer (MODIS) global land cover (MODIS land cover) have recently became available. The Joint Research Center (JRC) of the European Commission (EC) implemented the GLC-2000 project in partnership with more than 30 partner institutions around the world, using Satellite Pour l’Observation de la Terre (SPOT) VEGETATION 1-km satellite data (Fritz et al., 2003). Boston University prepared the MODIS land cover data using MODIS 1-km satellite data on board the Terra satellite (Friedl et al., 2002). Both data sets were prepared with the same fundamental goal: to improve our understanding of the extent and distribution of the major land cover types of the world. The information generated can be used for various applications including ecosystem and biodiversity assessments, climate change studies, and environmental modeling (Brown, Loveland, Ohlen, & Zhu, 1999; Giri, Defourny, & Shrestha, 2003; Loveland & Belward, 1997; Loveland, Estes, & Scepan, 1999; Reed, 1997).
research objective: We compared the recently available Global Land Cover 2000 (GLC-2000) and MODerate resolution Imaging Spectrometer (MODIS) global land cover data to evaluate the similarities and differences in methodologies and results, and to identify areas of spatial agreement and disagreement. Learning from past experience and building on the existing infrastructure (e.g., regional networks), further research is necessary to (1) reduce ambiguity in land cover definitions, (2) increase availability of improved spatial, spectral, radiometric, and geometric resolution satellite data, and (3) develop advanced classification algorithms.
challenges: Yet, we are far from producing geospatially consistent high-quality data at an operational level.
methods: We assume that the time difference of approximately 10 months between these two data sets is negligible in our comparative analysis. The GLC-2000 v1.1 data were downloaded from the worldwide web at URL http://www.gvm.sai.jrc.it/glc2000/ (last accessed 24 February 2004). We acquired the data in the Geographic Coordinate projection system, and reprojected it to Interrupted Goode Homolosine projection system. The MODIS land cover data were acquired from the Earth Observing System (EOS) Data Gateway, http://edcimswww.cr.usgs.gov/pub/imswelcome/ (last accessed 12 February 2004). The data, which are available in Hierarchical Data Format (HDF), were downloaded as tiles in Interrupted Goode Homolosine projection system. The individual tiles were mosaicked together for global coverage using MODIS Reprojection Tool 3.0 (available at URL http://lpdaac2.usgs.gov/landdaac/tools/modis/index.asp ). We used the IGBP layer of the MODIS land cover which contains 17 land cover classes. The latter was aggregated into 17 classes to make it consistent with the MODIS land cover classification system. Global area totals were computed for aggregated land cover classes and also for the IGBP classes. Pixel-by-pixel comparisons also were performed between the generalized (with eight classes) GLC-2000 and MODIS land cover data. The percent agreement and disagreement were calculated using the following equations: Overall percent agreement = (Σr i=1 Xi Yi / C18/C19) × 100 and Overall percent disagreement = 1 - (Σr i=1 Xi Yi / C18/C19) × 100.
dataset: These two global land cover data sets were prepared using different data sources, classification systems, and methodologies, but using the same spatial resolution (i.e., 1 km) satellite data.
findings: Our analysis shows a general agreement at the class aggregate level except for savannas/shrublands, and wetlands. The disagreement, however, increases when comparing detailed land cover classes. Similarly, percent agreement between the two data sets was found to be highly variable among biomes. The identified areas of spatial agreement and disagreement will be useful for both data producers and users.
backgroundCn: 准确和最新的全球土地覆盖数据集对于气候变化、生物多样性保护、生态系统评估和环境建模等各种全球变化研究至关重要。近年来，在生成此类数据产品方面取得了显著进展。两个新的全球土地覆盖数据集，全球土地覆盖2000（GLC-2000）和中分辨率成像光谱仪（MODIS）全球土地覆盖（MODIS土地覆盖）最近已可用。欧洲委员会（EC）联合研究中心（JRC）与全球30多个合作机构合作实施了GLC-2000项目，使用了1公里分辨率的卫星数据（Fritz et al., 2003）。波士顿大学利用搭载在Terra卫星上的MODIS 1公里卫星数据准备了MODIS土地覆盖数据（Friedl et al., 2002）。这两个数据集的基本目标相同：改善我们对世界主要土地覆盖类型的范围和分布的理解。生成的信息可用于生态系统和生物多样性评估、气候变化研究和环境建模等各种应用（Brown, Loveland, Ohlen, & Zhu, 1999; Giri, Defourny, & Shrestha, 2003; Loveland & Belward, 1997; Loveland, Estes, & Scepan, 1999; Reed, 1997）。
research objectiveCn: 我们比较了最近发布的全球土地覆盖2000（GLC-2000）和中分辨率成像光谱仪（MODIS）全球土地覆盖数据，以评估方法和结果的相似性与差异，并识别空间一致性和不一致的区域。借鉴过去的经验，并在现有基础设施（例如区域网络）的基础上，进一步研究是必要的，以（1）减少土地覆盖定义中的模糊性，（2）增加改进的空间、光谱、辐射和几何分辨率卫星数据的可用性，以及（3）开发先进的分类算法。
challengesCn: 然而，我们在生产地理空间一致的高质量数据方面仍然远未达到操作水平。
methodsCn: 我们假设这两个数据集之间大约10个月的时间差在我们的比较分析中是可以忽略的。GLC-2000 v1.1 数据是从全球网络下载的，网址为 http://www.gvm.sai.jrc.it/glc2000/（最后访问时间：2004年2月24日）。我们以地理坐标投影系统获取数据，并将其重新投影为中断的古德同纬投影系统。MODIS土地覆盖数据是从地球观测系统（EOS）数据网关获取的，网址为 http://edcimswww.cr.usgs.gov/pub/imswelcome/（最后访问时间：2004年2月12日）。这些数据以层次数据格式（HDF）提供，作为中断的古德同纬投影系统的切片下载。使用MODIS重投影工具3.0（可在网址 http://lpdaac2.usgs.gov/landdaac/tools/modis/index.asp 获取），将单个切片拼接在一起以实现全球覆盖。我们使用了MODIS土地覆盖的IGBP层，该层包含17个土地覆盖类别。后者被聚合为17个类别，以使其与MODIS土地覆盖分类系统一致。还计算了聚合土地覆盖类别和IGBP类别的全球面积总量。还对一般化的（具有八个类别的）GLC-2000和MODIS土地覆盖数据进行了逐像素比较。使用以下公式计算百分比一致性和不一致性：总体百分比一致性 = (Σr i=1 Xi Yi / C18/C19) × 100 和总体百分比不一致性 = 1 - (Σr i=1 Xi Yi / C18/C19) × 100。
datasetCn: 这两个全球土地覆盖数据集是使用不同的数据源、分类系统和方法准备的，但使用了相同的空间分辨率（即1公里）卫星数据。
findingsCn: 我们的分析显示，在类别总量层面上，除了草原/灌木丛和湿地外，整体一致性较高。然而，当比较详细的土地覆盖类别时，不一致性增加。同样，不同生物群落之间的百分比一致性在两个数据集之间也表现出高度的变异性。识别出的空间一致性和不一致性区域将对数据生产者和用户都具有重要价值。

background: It is very difficult to have remote sensing data with both high spatial resolution and high temporal frequency; thus, two categories of land-use mapping methodology have been developed separately for coarser resolution and finer resolution data. Land use and land cover are the key factors for understanding the interactions between global changes and human activities, such as social, economic, and cultural activities. Moreover, it is one of the key parameters of land process modeling, and more accurate land use and land cover data will improve the accuracy of ecological, hydrological, and atmospheric models. Consequently, land use and land cover data are now widely used in many kinds of researches, such as biodiversity, carbon cycle, public health, crop yield estimation, urban sprawl, forest monitoring, and so on. Since land cover/use can be retrieved straightforwardly from remote sensing, many land cover/use mapping methods using remotely sensed data have been developed for the purposes of regional or global applications.
research objective: Therefore, by taking the spatiotemporal advantage of HJ-1/CCD data we propose a new method for finer resolution land cover mapping using the time series HJ-1/CCD data, which can greatly improve the land cover mapping accuracy.
challenges: This method uses much more data and dramatically increases the computation loading; the not very good geometric and radiometric qualities of HJ-1/CCD data lower its usability and increase the difficulty in its use.
methods: In our two study areas, the very high resolution remote sensing data within Google Earth are used to validate the land cover mapping results, which shows a very high mapping accuracy of 95.76% and 83.78% and a high Kappa coefficient of 0.9423 and 0.8165 in the Dahuofang area of Liaoning Province and the Heiquan area of Gansu Province respectively.
dataset: The HJ-1 satellite constellation consists of three satellites, named as HJ-1A, HJ-1B, and HJ-1C respectively. For CCD cameras, their nominal spatial resolution is 30 m. HJ-1/CCDs have three visible bands (430–520 nm, 520–600 nm, and 630–690 nm) and one near-infrared band (760–900 nm). The time series data are composed of one dataset per month, so this time series of data can depict the variation of typical land surface.
findings: The overall accuracy for classification result using the time series of HJ-1/CCD data is 96.76% and the Kappa coefficient is 0.9423; the corresponding overall accuracy and Kappa coefficient for classification result using single Hj-1/CCD data are 87.59% and 0.8296 respectively. Compared with the classification result from single Hj-1/CCD data, the overall accuracy of classification result using the time series HJ-1/CCD data is more than 10% and the Kappa coefficient is more than 0.1. The overall accuracy and Kappa coefficient of classification result using the time series HJ-1/CCD data are 83.78% and 0.8165 respectively; those using single HJ-1/CCD data are 70.82% and 0.665 respectively. It is similar to the comparison in the Dahuofang area that the overall accuracy of classification result using the time series HJ-1/CCD data is also 10% higher and Kappa coefficient is also 0.1 higher than that of classification result using single HJ-1/CCD data.
backgroundCn: 由于高空间分辨率和高时间频率的遥感数据难以获取，因此分别为较粗分辨率和较细分辨率数据开发了两类土地利用制图方法。土地利用和土地覆盖是理解全球变化与人类活动（如社会、经济和文化活动）之间相互作用的关键因素。此外，它们是土地过程建模的关键参数，更准确的土地利用和土地覆盖数据将提高生态、水文和大气模型的准确性。因此，土地利用和土地覆盖数据现在广泛应用于多种研究，如生物多样性、碳循环、公共健康、作物产量估计、城市扩张、森林监测等。由于土地覆盖/利用可以通过遥感直接获取，因此已经开发了许多利用遥感数据进行土地覆盖/利用制图的方法，以满足区域或全球应用的需求。
research objectiveCn: 因此，通过利用HJ-1/CCD数据的时空优势，我们提出了一种新的方法，利用时间序列HJ-1/CCD数据进行更精细的土地覆盖制图，这可以大大提高土地覆盖制图的准确性。
challengesCn: 该方法使用了更多的数据，并显著增加了计算负载；HJ-1/CCD数据的几何和辐射质量不佳降低了其可用性，并增加了使用上的难度。
methodsCn: 在我们的两个研究区域，使用Google Earth中的超高分辨率遥感数据来验证土地覆盖制图结果，显示出大连的映射准确率非常高，分别为95.76%和83.78%，而Kappa系数也很高，分别为0.9423和0.8165，分别在辽宁省的大伙房地区和甘肃省的黑泉地区。
datasetCn: HJ-1卫星星座由三颗卫星组成，分别命名为HJ-1A、HJ-1B和HJ-1C。其CCD相机的标称空间分辨率为30米。HJ-1/CCD具有三个可见光波段（430–520纳米、520–600纳米和630–690纳米）和一个近红外波段（760–900纳米）。时间序列数据由每月一个数据集组成，因此这组时间序列数据可以描绘典型陆地表面的变化。
findingsCn: 使用HJ-1/CCD数据的时间序列进行分类的整体准确率为96.76%，Kappa系数为0.9423；而使用单一HJ-1/CCD数据的分类结果对应的整体准确率和Kappa系数分别为87.59%和0.8296。与单一HJ-1/CCD数据的分类结果相比，使用时间序列HJ-1/CCD数据的分类结果整体准确率提高了10%以上，Kappa系数提高了0.1以上。使用时间序列HJ-1/CCD数据的分类结果的整体准确率和Kappa系数分别为83.78%和0.8165；而使用单一HJ-1/CCD数据的分类结果的整体准确率和Kappa系数分别为70.82%和0.665。与大伙房地区的比较类似，使用时间序列HJ-1/CCD数据的分类结果的整体准确率也比单一HJ-1/CCD数据的分类结果高出10%，Kappa系数也高出0.1。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of a data collection method that utilizes both high spatial resolution and high temporal frequency for land-use mapping?

Example.AnswerEn: A data collection method that utilizes both high spatial resolution and high temporal frequency for land-use mapping is the use of time series HJ-1/CCD data. This approach involves selecting monthly HJ-1/CCD images to form a time series, where each month's best image is used to capture dynamic changes in land cover. This method enhances mapping accuracy by leveraging the detailed temporal and spatial information available in the HJ-1/CCD data.
Example.AnswerCn: 一种利用高空间分辨率和高时间频率进行土地利用制图的数据收集方法是使用时间序列HJ-1/CCD数据。这种方法涉及选择每月的HJ-1/CCD影像形成时间序列，其中每个月的最佳影像用于捕捉土地覆盖的动态变化。这种方法通过利用HJ-1/CCD数据中可用的详细时间和空间信息，提高了制图的准确性。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a challenge in land-cover classification using optical remotely sensed imagery, particularly in arid regions?
Example.QuestionCn: 在干旱地区，使用光学遥感影像进行土地覆盖分类的一个挑战是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: An example of a challenge in land-cover classification using optical remotely sensed imagery, especially in arid regions, is the high uncertainty in differentiating between cropland and grassland categories, as well as among shrub, grassland, and forest categories. This uncertainty is exacerbated by the arid conditions, where vegetation cover may not meet the minimum threshold required for accurate classification, leading to potential errors in eco-hydrological and land-process modeling.
Example.AnswerCn: 使用光学遥感影像进行土地覆盖分类的一个挑战，尤其是在干旱地区，是在区分农田和草地类别时存在较高的不确定性，以及在灌木、草地和森林类别之间的区分。这种不确定性在干旱条件下更加严重，因为植被覆盖可能未达到准确分类所需的最低阈值，从而导致生态水文和土地过程建模中的潜在错误。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by 'multiscale dataset' in eco-hydrological research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在生态水文学研究中，“多尺度数据集”是指在不同空间和时间尺度上收集和整合的数据。这些数据集可以包括从微观（如土壤水分）到宏观（如流域水文循环）的各种信息，以便更全面地理解生态系统与水文过程之间的相互作用。
Definition.AnswerEn: A multiscale dataset in eco-hydrological research refers to the collection of data at different hierarchical levels and scales to capture diverse processes in the ecosystem. This includes data from instruments like eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, soil moisture sensors, and remote sensing technologies like LiDAR and imaging spectrometers, all contributing to a comprehensive understanding of eco-hydrological processes across scales.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在生态水文研究中，多尺度数据集指的是在不同层次和尺度上收集的数据，以捕捉生态系统中的多样化过程。这包括来自涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站、土壤湿度传感器以及遥感技术（如激光雷达和成像光谱仪）的数据，所有这些都为全面理解跨尺度的生态水文过程做出了贡献。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'geometric and radiometric qualities' refer to in the context of remote sensing data usability?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在遥感数据可用性上下文中，“几何和辐射特性”指的是数据的空间精度和光谱精度。
Definition.AnswerEn: Geometric and radiometric qualities in remote sensing data refer to the accuracy of the spatial representation and the fidelity of the spectral information captured in the images. Geometric quality ensures that the spatial dimensions and positioning of features are accurate, while radiometric quality relates to the precision of the brightness and color information. High-quality geometric and radiometric data are crucial for accurate data analysis and mapping, affecting the usability and reliability of remote sensing applications.
Definition.AnswerCn: 遥感数据中的几何质量和辐射质量指的是空间表现的准确性和图像中捕获的光谱信息的真实性。几何质量确保特征的空间维度和位置是准确的，而辐射质量则与亮度和颜色信息的精确性有关。高质量的几何和辐射数据对于准确的数据分析和制图至关重要，影响着遥感应用的可用性和可靠性。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection techniques utilized in the Heihe Watershed experiment compare to those used in generating the 黑河流域土地利用覆盖数据集 in terms of spatial resolution and temporal frequency?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在黑河流域实验中使用的数据收集技术与生成黑河流域土地利用覆盖数据集所采用的技术在空间分辨率和时间频率方面有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The Heihe Watershed experiment employs a multiscale dataset with instruments arranged at hierarchically nested scales, including LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, and other advanced tools to capture eco-hydrological processes with high temporal frequency. In contrast, the 黑河流域土地利用覆盖数据集 uses HJ/CCD satellite data which offers a high spatial resolution of 30m and a revisit time of 2 days, enabling frequent temporal data collection for land use mapping with enhanced accuracy.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 黑河流域实验采用多尺度数据集，仪器按层次嵌套的尺度排列，包括激光雷达、成像光谱仪和其他先进工具，以高时间频率捕捉生态水文过程。相比之下，黑河流域土地利用覆盖数据集使用HJ/CCD卫星数据，提供30米的高空间分辨率和2天的重访时间，使得土地利用制图的频繁时间数据收集具有更高的准确性。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in challenges faced when using HJ-1/CCD data for land-cover classification compared to using other global land-cover datasets like GLC-2000 and MODIS?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用HJ-1/CCD数据进行土地覆盖分类时，与使用其他全球土地覆盖数据集如GLC-2000和MODIS相比，面临的挑战有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Using HJ-1/CCD data presents challenges such as the need for extensive data handling due to larger data volumes and the requirement for significant preprocessing to address geometric and radiometric quality issues. In contrast, global datasets like GLC-2000 and MODIS face challenges related to consistency and classification accuracy across different biomes and land-cover types, often leading to discrepancies in areas with similar spectral characteristics.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 使用HJ-1/CCD数据面临挑战，例如由于数据量大需要进行大量的数据处理，以及需要进行显著的预处理以解决几何和辐射质量问题。相比之下，全球数据集如GLC-2000和MODIS面临与不同生物群落和土地覆盖类型的一致性和分类准确性相关的挑战，常常导致在具有相似光谱特征的区域出现差异。

Comparison.QuestionEn: In terms of classification accuracy, how does the use of time series HJ-1/CCD data compare to single-date remote sensing data in land-cover mapping?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 在分类准确性方面，时间序列HJ-1/CCD数据与单日期遥感数据在土地覆盖制图中的比较如何？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The use of time series HJ-1/CCD data significantly improves classification accuracy compared to single-date remote sensing data. Time series data offer a higher overall accuracy and Kappa coefficient, with improvements of over 10% in accuracy and 0.1 in Kappa coefficient, allowing for a more detailed and reliable representation of land cover changes over time.

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the integration of high-resolution and high-temporal-frequency remote sensing data improve the accuracy and detail of land cover mapping in eco-hydrological studies?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 高分辨率和高时间频率的遥感数据的整合如何提高生态水文研究中土地覆盖制图的准确性和细节。
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The integration of high-resolution and high-temporal-frequency remote sensing data allows for capturing detailed dynamic changes in land cover, enhancing the classification accuracy. By using datasets like HJ-1/CCD, which provide high spatial and temporal resolution, researchers can improve the detail and precision in identifying various land cover types, such as distinguishing between cropland and grassland or small water bodies and buildings, which are often challenging with lower resolution data.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 高分辨率和高时间频率的遥感数据的整合能够捕捉土地覆盖的详细动态变化，从而提高分类准确性。通过使用像HJ-1/CCD这样的数据集，提供高空间和时间分辨率，研究人员可以在识别各种土地覆盖类型时提高细节和精确度，例如区分农田和草地或小水体和建筑物，这在较低分辨率的数据中通常是具有挑战性的。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors lead to challenges in achieving high classification accuracy in land-cover mapping using remote-sensing data?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 导致使用遥感数据进行土地覆盖制图时实现高分类准确率的挑战的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The primary factors include the variability in data quality and properties, the lack of a standardized approach for classifying continuous vegetation cover, and inconsistencies with Earth System Model requirements. Additionally, the highest uncertainty often arises between categories like cropland and grassland, especially in arid regions, due to differences in the minimum threshold for forest cover.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 主要因素包括数据质量和属性的变异性、缺乏标准化的连续植被覆盖分类方法，以及与地球系统模型要求的不一致。此外，最高的不确定性通常出现在农田和草地等类别之间，尤其是在干旱地区，这主要是由于森林覆盖的最低阈值差异所导致的。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it difficult to obtain remote sensing data with both high spatial resolution and high temporal frequency for land-use mapping?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么获取具有高空间分辨率和高时间频率的遥感数据用于土地利用制图是困难的？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: It is challenging because high spatial resolution data typically have a longer revisit cycle, making it difficult to capture frequent changes, while data with high temporal frequency often have coarser spatial resolution. This trade-off necessitates separate methodologies for different resolutions, complicating land-use mapping efforts.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 这很具有挑战性，因为高空间分辨率的数据通常具有较长的重访周期，这使得捕捉频繁变化变得困难，而具有高时间频率的数据往往具有较粗的空间分辨率。这种权衡需要针对不同分辨率采用不同的方法，增加了土地利用制图的复杂性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What causes limitations in the usability of HJ-1/CCD data for land-cover classification?

Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 这些限制主要是由于HJ-1/CCD数据的几何和辐射质量不佳，这需要进行大量的预处理。这些问题增加了有效使用数据的难度，并且需要大量的计算资源，使得这一过程变得更加复杂和资源密集。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does employing a time series of higher spatial resolution data affect the accuracy and cost-efficiency of land cover classification methods?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用更高空间分辨率数据的时间序列如何影响土地覆盖分类方法的准确性和成本效率？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using time series data with higher spatial resolution, such as HJ-1/CCD data, improves the accuracy of land cover classification by capturing dynamic changes in the surface, thereby enhancing both the precision and reliability of the classification. However, this approach requires more data, which increases computational load and necessitates extensive preprocessing, potentially raising costs and requiring more manual effort.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用更高空间分辨率的时间序列数据，如HJ-1/CCD数据，可以通过捕捉地表的动态变化来提高土地覆盖分类的准确性，从而增强分类的精度和可靠性。然而，这种方法需要更多的数据，这增加了计算负担，并且需要大量的预处理，可能会提高成本并需要更多的人工努力。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential consequences of integrating multiple classifiers and multisource remotely sensed data in improving eco-hydrological modeling accuracy?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 整合多个分类器和多源遥感数据在提高生态水文模型准确性方面的潜在后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating multiple classifiers and multisource remotely sensed data can enhance eco-hydrological modeling accuracy by providing more detailed and varied information about land cover, thus reducing uncertainties in classification. This approach allows for more precise mapping of crop and vegetation categories, which is crucial in arid regions where vegetation classification is challenging. However, it demands significant data processing capabilities and expertise in managing diverse data sources.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 整合多种分类器和多源遥感数据可以通过提供更详细和多样化的土地覆盖信息来提高生态水文模型的准确性，从而减少分类中的不确定性。这种方法允许对作物和植被类别进行更精确的制图，这在植被分类具有挑战性的干旱地区尤为重要。然而，这需要显著的数据处理能力和管理多样数据源的专业知识。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What is the impact on the classification accuracy when using a combination of traditional land cover datasets and new methodologies involving HJ-1/CCD data?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用传统土地覆盖数据集和涉及HJ-1/CCD数据的新方法的组合对分类准确性的影响是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Combining traditional land cover datasets with new methodologies using HJ-1/CCD data leads to improved classification accuracy, as these methods leverage the strengths of higher spatial and temporal resolution data. This combination increases the agreement with actual land cover conditions, particularly for categories like water bodies, building areas, and cropland. The overall classification accuracy can improve by approximately 10% compared to methods using single datasets.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将传统土地覆盖数据集与使用HJ-1/CCD数据的新方法相结合，可以提高分类准确性，因为这些方法利用了更高空间和时间分辨率数据的优势。这种结合增加了与实际土地覆盖条件的一致性，特别是在水体、建筑区域和农田等类别上。与仅使用单一数据集的方法相比，整体分类准确性可以提高约10%。

Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 使用HJ-1/CCD数据对黑河流域进行土地覆盖分类的主要目标是提高生态水文和土地过程模型的准确性。这是通过开发一种综合方法来实现的，该方法利用多种分类器和具有不同时空分辨率和光谱波段的多源遥感数据，绘制具有细致空间分辨率和更多作物/植被类别的月度土地覆盖图。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the key steps involved in processing remote sensing data to improve land cover classification accuracy?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 处理遥感数据以提高土地覆盖分类准确性的关键步骤包括：
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The key steps involve selecting the best monthly HJ-1/CCD images to form a time series for the research area. Preprocessing includes geometric correction, radiometric calibration, and atmospheric correction. The NDVI time series is used as input for the SVM classifier, and additional indices like NDBI and NDWI are used to differentiate between water, buildings, and vegetation. Post-classification processing involves using texture information to improve differentiation between buildings and tidal flats.

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the challenges faced in using HJ-1/CCD data for land cover mapping, and how can these be overcome?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 使用HJ-1/CCD数据进行土地覆盖制图面临的挑战有哪些，以及如何克服这些挑战？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The challenges include the need for large amounts of data and increased computational load, as well as the geometric and radiometric limitations of HJ-1/CCD data that require extensive preprocessing. These can be overcome by ensuring thorough data preprocessing and using advanced techniques like SVM classifiers and texture analysis to improve classification accuracy.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 挑战包括对大量数据和增加的计算负载的需求，以及HJ-1/CCD数据的几何和辐射限制，这需要进行广泛的预处理。通过确保彻底的数据预处理和使用先进的技术，如支持向量机（SVM）分类器和纹理分析，可以提高分类准确性，从而克服这些挑战。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What observational strategies enable the capture of multi-scale eco-hydrological processes in an oasis-desert system?

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand how remote sensing data can be used for accurate land-cover classification in eco-hydrological studies.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白遥感数据如何在生态水文研究中用于准确的土地覆盖分类。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Remote sensing data, such as HJ-1/CCD data, are used in eco-hydrological studies for land-cover classification due to their ability to capture spatial and temporal variations in land cover. By using indices like NDVI and combining these with classification algorithms such as SVM, researchers can differentiate between various land cover types more precisely.

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand why multiscale observations are important for eco-hydrological research in heterogeneous landscapes.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白为什么多尺度观测对异质景观中的生态水文研究很重要。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Multiscale observations are crucial for eco-hydrological research in heterogeneous landscapes because they provide comprehensive data across different spatial and temporal scales needed to capture the complex interactions between various eco-hydrological processes. By using a combination of ground-based sensors, airborne remote sensing, and other observational techniques, researchers can gather detailed data on vegetation dynamics, soil moisture, and hydrometeorological variables, leading to a better understanding of the interactions within oasis-desert systems and improving model accuracy.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测对于异质景观中的生态水文研究至关重要，因为它们提供了跨越不同空间和时间尺度的综合数据，能够捕捉各种生态水文过程之间的复杂相互作用。通过结合地面传感器、空中遥感和其他观测技术，研究人员可以收集关于植被动态、土壤湿度和气象水文变量的详细数据，从而更好地理解绿洲-沙漠系统内的相互作用，并提高模型的准确性。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please provide a summary of the classification methods used for land-cover mapping in the Heihe River Basin and how they address the challenges of distinguishing between cropland and grassland.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请提供对黑河流域土地覆盖制图中使用的分类方法的总结，以及它们如何应对区分农田和草地的挑战。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The classification methods used for land-cover mapping in the Heihe River Basin involve utilizing a mosaic of Landsat/TM imagery and HJ-1/CCD images, which are corrected through image-to-image registration. The methodology includes converting DN values to TOA radiance, removing atmospheric effects to obtain surface reflectance, and creating time series mosaics. This approach addresses the challenges of distinguishing between cropland and grassland by using high-resolution images and multiple classifiers, leading to improved accuracy and a classification accuracy of over 90%.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在黑河流域的土地覆盖制图中，分类方法涉及利用Landsat/TM影像和HJ-1/CCD影像的马赛克，这些影像通过影像间配准进行校正。该方法包括将DN值转换为TOA辐射率，去除大气影响以获得表面反射率，并创建时间序列马赛克。这种方法通过使用高分辨率影像和多种分类器，解决了区分农田和草地的挑战，从而提高了准确性，分类准确率超过90%。
